availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To his excellency Beriah Magoffin
Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your petitioner Moses Sowards would respectfully represent unto your excellency that at the April terme of the Pike circuit court 18549. There was a Judgment of $60.00 obtained against him for Keeping a tipling House. He states that, it is true that he sold the whiskey but not to have the same drank upon the premises or premises adjacent thereto He directed the parties to take the same off of his premises and those adjacent that says they took it some distance from his house before they drank it. He never permitted any one to drink and tiple about his house. He states that he is poore with and with all the labour, that he perform's he is barely able to suport his family. In consideration of the premises he respectfully asks your excellency to remit.
We believe that the prayer of the petitioner ought to be granted.

John M Fidler
James N Draper
James M. Sowards
Colbert Cecil
C Cecil Jr
Thos D Meirrs
John Scott
Jas Deskins
S. K Damron
D Uray
J. W. Reynolds
